article:
Polly Tyner is president of the board of trustees of schools in Palo Alto.California.Her son, Jim, had great  _  in
school.He was classified as educationally handicapped and required a great deal of  _  on the part of his parents and teachers.But Jim was a happy kid with a great smile that   lit up  the room.  His parents acknowledged his39 _ difficulties,but always tried to help him see his strengths so that he could walk with   _  .
        Shortly after Jim finished high school, he was  _  in a motorcycle
accident. After his death, his mother submitted this letter to the Palo Alto
Times:
  Today we buried our 20-year-old son. He was killed instantly in a motorcycle accident   _  Friday night. How I wish I had known  _  I
talked to him last that it would be the last time. If I had only known I would
have  _  , "Jim, I love you and I'm so very proud
of you."
  I would have taken the time to   _  the many blessings he
brought to the lives of the many who loved him. I would have taken time to
appreciate his beautiful  _  , the sound of his
laughter, his genuine love of people.
  I won't get another  _  to tell my son all I would have wanted him to
hear, but, other  _  , you do have a chance. Tell your
young people  _  you would want them to hear if
you knew it would be your last  _  . The last time I
talked to Jim was the day he died. He called me to say, "Hi, Mom! I just
called to say I  _  you. Got to go to work.
Bye." He gave me something to  _  forever.
  If there is any purpose at all to Jim's death, maybe it is to make others   _  more of life and to have people,  _  families,
take the time to let each other know just how much we care.
  You may  _  have another chance. Do it today!
